ACT
48
Terms and conditions
(1) If the testator intended something for someone in his will with an encumbrance of an order, that order will be considered a termination condition, so that the person encumbered by the order loses what was intended for him if he does not fulfill the order.
(2) Illegal and immoral orders shall be deemed not to exist.
(3) If the order cannot be fulfilled exactly, it should be fulfilled as close as possible.
(4) If the order cannot be fulfilled at all, the person burdened by the order may keep what was left to him, unless the testator's will states otherwise or if he cannot fulfill the order due to his own fault.
(5) If the testator expressed his will about the purpose for which the legacy or something from it would serve, but did not assign it as a duty to the heir or the person to whom he intended it in the will, they are not obliged to use it for that purpose.
